Normally encloses just one word. NationalityHeritage captures information about the nationality of a person's family which contributes to an understanding of their racial and ethnic background. With value Welsh it might record a writerâ€™s emotional connection with Wales despite birth and lifelong residence in England. It gestures towards hyphenated identities such as Japanese-Canadian. While Joy Kogawa's nationality is Canadian, her national heritage is Japanese. See RACEANDETHNICITY for a detailed description of the complexities of this element. It has optional attributes of CURRENTALTERNATIVETERM, FOREBEAR, SELF-DEFINED, and REG. REG allows you to represent the national heritage in a more precise or standardised way, whether or not you have been able to do so in your prose. FOREBEAR provides a means of attributing this heritage to an individual, recognizing an Irish grandmother for instance.
